body: I hugged her cold body for- I can't even remember how long- I held her tight, knowing this would be the last time I'd ever feel her touch. At some point, I fell asleep and when I woke up, the light poring from the window cast a long shadow into the room. It felt eerie. It reminded me of how strange it felt to be in this room where we spent so much time together. A room where Kaori would no longer be able to cuddle up to me. After an amount of time, I lifted my dreary body into the kitchen, took a pair of scissors and gently- careful not to damage her neck (not that it would have made any difference)- cut loose the rope. She fell with a loud thud on the ground. I lifted her pristine dress over her head, removing all her garments and stared at her naked body, taking in every last detail. Admittedly, the purplish hue by her neck tainted her beauty but if you ignore that detail, she was as beautiful as the day I met her. I love you Kaori... And I'm sorry for not being there for you. (6)

After Takumi died for about 3 months, I came back by to visit Kaori. I knocked on the door but the room was completely silent. I thought this was strange, so I knocked again, opened the door and peeped inside. I thought she was probably sleeping or wasn't in. But she was standing by the window, staring outside, with her neck bent at a kind of angle, like she was thinking, taking in the night view. The room was dark, the lights were out, and it was hard to see anything. That's when I noticed that she looked taller than usual. It was amazing how kids grew so fast- at this rate, I thought, it wouldn't even be inappropriate for me to have sex with her. I moved closer and was just about to speak to her again when I saw it- there was a rope above her head. It came straight down from a beam in the ceiling- K...K...Kaori... I remember crying out, hugging her legs as her body failed by her neck. I sobbed endlessly into her dress. (5)

While walking, all of a sudden- it just hit me! As though enlightened in the overwhelming sunset, the thought came to mind 'OH! I get it now! Takumi had the same look too!'. Only on my next visit here did I realise it was too late. This town had an oppressive claustrophobic tension that dwelled in the people that makes each and every individual only care for themselves. Even when Takumi died, it took 3 days for anyone to find his body. He'd hung himself by the tree in his backyard, right where his father used to play catch with him. For 3 days, even while his parents searched fervently for him, calling his classmates, the teachers, the neighbours, they never thought to check the backyard, a place they spent so much of his childhood on. This town is cruel- I thought to myself. It was only when the pungent odor of his corpse started to attract some insects did they find him. (4)

..and a while back, when I passed Kaori in the halls, it just hit me 'OH! She has that same look as nee-chan'. And that's pretty much it. I enjoy being with Kaori. It's like being with her again." That was the type of conversation we'd have in those sparse few minutes. On the last day there, I didn't manage to chat with Takumi. He never came. Since that was the last day, I never managed to have that routine chat with him. Maybe I'd have learned something new? I don't know. It finally hit me some dozen years later when I visited this empty town again. I'd come alone, on a whim. I don't know why. Why. Why  after after all these years? Walking this lonesome stretch of road, the same broken tire still lingering by the side of the road, no one bothered clearing it. It reminded me of how little- anything changed. We keep thinking we grow as we age but we're the same foolish people no matter how much time passes. (3)

I stayed in the village for about one month and in that time I didn't have sex with Kaori once. I'd still ruffle her hair and hug her close but it would never go further than that. She was growing so she no longer had that child-like beauty that I was so enamored with so that naturally played a factor but more importantly, it was for the best. There was no need for me to fill the gap Takumi had already done. During the daily meetings with Takumi when he'd leave to reach his house by 9.00pm, I'd take a stroll with him to his house, taking the opportunity to poke him with questions. "Why are you with Kaori?" I'd ask. He'd shrug and after a moment of silence, say in a non-nonchalant voice "She reminds me of my sis, y'know?" "How so?" "Hmm... there's something about Kaori. She's got that look that looks like she's holding it in?" "Diarrhea?" "HAHAHA! Nah- like she's going to end her life at any time." "Oh." "Yeah- it took me awhile to connect the dots but my sis had the look...(2)

Fanfic time- A year later when I returned to this quiet town Kaori had changed dramatically. Her hair was longer and her skirt was shorter. Her body blossomed ever so slightly, reminding me of the ephemeral nature of this girl's youthful body. The bullying still continued yet despite my absence, the cuts on her arm remained the same. There was a bittersweet reason to this change. She'd met a young boy, by the name of Takumi. A senior of hers by two years who I heard from various rumours was a rather studious kid. His family had immense expectation of him as the only child and his school schedule was an endless cycle of lessons. After school, he'd have cram school until 7.30pm and his strict parents set a rule for him to return by 9.00pm. Excluding traveling time, often they'd only manage to squeeze in about an hours worth of time to be together. It was short but this brief period that accumulated over the weeks managed to fill in the gap that Kaori's parents and I had left. (1)
